meanings.sent1: His chauvinisms made him always put his country first.
meanings.sent2: Her chauvinisms were evident in the way she proudly waved the national flag.
meanings.sent3: The man's chauvinisms were so extreme that he painted his entire house in the national colors.
meanings.sent4: The chauvinisms of the politician were like a loud trumpet blaring patriotism.
meanings.sent5: The chauvinisms of the old veteran were as deep as the roots of an ancient tree.

meanings.definition: Prejudiced belief in the superiority of one's own gender.
meanings.sent1: She displayed her chauvinisms by claiming that women were inherently better leaders.
meanings.sent2: His chauvinisms led him to believe that men were more rational than women.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the absurdity of gender chauvinisms in a hilarious skit.
meanings.sent4: Her gender chauvinisms were like a thick fog clouding her judgment.
meanings.sent5: The teacher addressed the students' chauvinisms by promoting equality and respect for all genders.

meanings.definition: Belief in the superiority of one's own race.
meanings.sent1: Their chauvinisms led to discriminatory practices against people of different races.
meanings.sent2: The history of colonialism is filled with examples of racial chauvinisms.
meanings.sent3: The absurdity of racial chauvinisms was highlighted in a satirical cartoon.
meanings.sent4: His racial chauvinisms were like a heavy chain weighing down his interactions with others.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of racial chauvinisms can be seen in the scars it leaves on society.
